      • properties

        public NonBlockingConnectionPool.Builder<T> properties(Properties properties)
        Sets the JDBC properties that will be passed to DriverManager.getConnection(java.lang.String, java.util.Properties). The properties will only be used if the url has been set in the builder.
        Parameters:
        properties - the jdbc properties
        Returns:
        this

                                                     Object value)

        Parameters:

        value - property value

      • maxIdleTime

        public NonBlockingConnectionPool.Builder<T> maxIdleTime(long duration,
                                                        TimeUnit unit)
        Sets the max time a Connection can be idle (checked in to pool) before it is released from the pool (the Connection is closed).
        Parameters:
        duration - the period before which an idle Connection is released from the pool (closed).
        unit - time unit
        Returns:
        this

      • idleTimeBeforeHealthCheck

        public NonBlockingConnectionPool.Builder<T> idleTimeBeforeHealthCheck(long duration,
                                                                      TimeUnit unit)
        Sets the minimum time that a connection must be idle (checked in) before on the next checkout its validity is checked using the health check function. If the health check fails then the Connection is closed (ignoring error) and released from the pool. Another Connection is then scheduled for creation (using the createRetryInterval delay).
        Parameters:
        duration - minimum time a connection must be idle before its validity is checked on checkout from the pool
        unit - time unit
        Returns:
        this

      • connectionRetryInterval

        public NonBlockingConnectionPool.Builder<T> connectionRetryInterval(long duration,
                                                                    TimeUnit unit)
        Sets the retry interval in the case that creating/reestablishing a Connection for use in the pool fails.
        Parameters:
        duration - Connection creation retry interval
        unit - time unit
        Returns:
        this

      • healthCheck

        public NonBlockingConnectionPool.Builder<T> healthCheck(io.reactivex.rxjava3.functions.Predicate<? super Connection> healthCheck)
        Sets the health check for a Connection in the pool that is run only if the time since the last checkout of this Connection finished is more than idleTimeBeforeHealthCheck and a checkout of this Connection has just been requested.
        Parameters:
        healthCheck - check to run on Connection. Returns true if and only if the Connection is valid/healthy.
        Returns:
        this

      • healthCheck

        public NonBlockingConnectionPool.Builder<T> healthCheck(DatabaseType databaseType)
        Sets the health check for a Connection in the pool that is run only if the time since the last checkout of this Connection finished is more than idleTimeBeforeHealthCheck and a checkout of this Connection has just been requested.
        Parameters:
        databaseType - the check to run is chosen based on the database type
        Returns:
        this

      • healthCheck

        public NonBlockingConnectionPool.Builder<T> healthCheck(String sql)
        Sets the health check for a Connection in the pool that is run only if the time since the last checkout of this Connection finished is more than idleTimeBeforeHealthCheck and a checkout of this Connection has just been requested.
        Parameters:
        sql - sql to run to check the validity of the connection. If the sql is run without error then the connection is assumed healthy.
        Returns:
        this

      • connectionListener

        public NonBlockingConnectionPool.Builder<T> connectionListener(io.reactivex.rxjava3.functions.Consumer<? super Optional<Throwable>> c)
        Sets a listener for connection success and failure. Success and failure events are reported serially to the listener. If the consumer throws it will be reported to RxJavaPlugins.onError. This consumer should not block otherwise it will block the connection pool itself.
        Parameters:
        c - listener for connection events
        Returns:
        this

      • maxPoolSize

        public NonBlockingConnectionPool.Builder<T> maxPoolSize(int maxPoolSize)
        Sets the maximum connection pool size. Default is 5.
        Parameters:
        maxPoolSize - maximum number of connections in the pool
        Returns:
        this

      • scheduler

        public NonBlockingConnectionPool.Builder<T> scheduler(io.reactivex.rxjava3.core.Scheduler scheduler)
        Sets the scheduler used for emitting connections (must be scheduled to another thread to break the chain of stack calls otherwise can get StackOverflowError) and for scheduling timeouts and retries. Defaults to Schedulers.from(Executors.newFixedThreadPool(maxPoolSize)). Do not set the scheduler to Schedulers.trampoline() because queries will block waiting for timeout workers. Also, do not use a single-threaded Scheduler because you may encounter StackOverflowError.
        Parameters:
        scheduler - scheduler to use for emitting connections and for scheduling timeouts and retries. Defaults to Schedulers.from(Executors.newFixedThreadPool(maxPoolSize)). Do not use Schedulers.trampoline().
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if trampoline specified

      • build

        public T build()
